knimeNode.name: FSKX Environment Creator
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates and configures a Conda environment for FSKX modeling and propagates it to downstream nodes.

fullDescription.intro:
This node creates a customizable Conda environment, designed for use in workflows involving FSKX models, and allows the environment to be propagated to downstream nodes that are Conda-aware. This enables users to replicate the environment configuration across different machines or servers seamlessly, making workflows portable and reproducible. Key steps for using this node are:
Ensure Conda is installed and properly configured in the KNIME preferences. Refer to the KNIME Python installation guide for setup instructions.
Configure the node by selecting a Conda environment or creating a new one. If creating a new environment, specify the language and packages required.
Upon execution without a dialog opening, the node will create a Conda environment using the language specified in the previous node and assign it a name based on the pattern "conda" + the model ID. This ensures that downstream nodes can execute within the correct environment configured for the workflow.
Connect this nodeâ€™s output port to Conda-aware nodes downstream using a flow variable port.
The downstream nodes, will use the propagated Conda environment.

ports.inPort: Optional flow variable to get LanguageWrittenIn and packages needed to be installed in the proposed Conda1 environment.
ports.outPort: Flow variable pointing to the created or configured Conda environment.
